questions.question: I have been in such a pickle …………………….. I saw you last.
questions.description: Since can indicate time. It is used to show the starting point of something.

questions.question: I ………………………… him since that unfortunate incident.
questions.description: When since indicates time, it is preceded by a verb in the present perfect tense.

questions.question: The soldiers were not wanting in strength or courage ……………………… they were badly fed.
questions.description: But is used to connect two contradictory ideas.

questions.question: I asked him ……………………… he would help me.
questions.description: We use if to introduce indirect questions.

questions.question: He was annoyed …………………………….. he was contradicted.
questions.description: We can use that to express a reason or cause. It is equivalent to because.

questions.question: He kept quiet …………………………… the situation wouldn’t get worse.
questions.description: That can indicate purpose. It is equivalent to in order that.

questions.question: He bled so profusely ……………………….. he died.
questions.description: That can express a consequence or result.

questions.question: I see you oftener …………………………. I see him.
questions.description: Than is a conjunction and it follows adjectives or adverbs in the comparative degree.

questions.question: …………………………. there is life, there is hope.
questions.description: While can mean during the time that. It is similar to as long as.

questions.question: …………………………….. this is true of some, it is not true of all.
He abhorred hypocrisy …………………………. he was not too stern with the hypocrite.
questions.description: We use but to connect two contradictory ideas.

questions.question: …………………………. he lived he was the guiding star of a brave nation.
